fr.eikasus.objectsmyfriends.misc

Class ControllerSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.eikasus.objectsmyfriends.misc.ControllerSupport

  • public class ControllerSupport
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to simplify handling HTML form.

    This class is used to minimize code repetition for managing HTML form and then simplify the controllers code. For exemple, this class give access to method for simplify error handling in forms.

    See Also:
    addUploadedImagesToItem(ManagerFactory, HttpServletRequest, Item, List), loadImage(HttpServletRequest, String), getUrlImage(HttpServletRequest, String), getUrlImageHandler(HttpServletRequest), getUrlServlet(HttpServletRequest, String), parseDateParameter(HttpServletRequest, String), parseIntegerParameter(HttpServletRequest, String), parseLongParameter(HttpServletRequest, String), saveForm(HttpServletRequest, HashMap), putFormError(ModelException, HttpServletRequest, HashMap), putFormError(ControllerException, HttpServletRequest, HashMap), getUserFromSession(ManagerFactory, HttpServletRequest), getItemFromSession(ManagerFactory, HttpServletRequest)

    • Method Detail

      • addUploadedImagesToItem

        public static void addUploadedImagesToItem(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull ManagerFactory managerFactory,
                                           @NotNull
                                           @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                           @NotNull
                                           @NotNull Item item,
                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> uploadedImages)
        Add images to the item.

        This method add the supplied images to the item. The images list only contain file names and those files should be present in the local storage. When each image is successfully added to the item, its corresponding image file is prefixed by the u letter to indicate that this file is pointed to. Then, in a maintenance process, all image file that aren't prefixed can then be deleted. If an error occur during the process, all remaining files are deleted. If something goes wrong during the process, no error is returned.

        Parameters:
        managerFactory - Instance of the manager factory to use.
        request - Request used to get context.
        item - Item to add image to.
        uploadedImages - Images to add to the item.

      • loadImage

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String loadImage(@NotNull
                                                            @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                            @NotNull
                                                            @NotNull java.lang.String paramName)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieve an image.

        This method retrieve an image sent via the multipart/form-data request and store it in the location returned by the getImagePath method. Only jpg and png file formats are allowed.

        Parameters:
        request - Request in which the file was received.
        paramName - Name of the parameter containing the file
        Returns:
        Name of the file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - In case of problem.

      • getUrlImage

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String getUrlImage(@NotNull
                                                              @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                              @NotNull
                                                              @NotNull java.lang.String fileName)
        Compute the url of an image.

        This method is used to create the url used to access the image from the client. Because the image entities only store the image filename and the place where those images are stored is not hardcoded, this function should be used to allow the client browser to load them.

        Parameters:
        request - Request needed to retrieve context.
        fileName - Name of the image file.
        Returns:
        Url to the image.

      • getUrlImageHandler

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String getUrlImageHandler(@NotNull
                                                                     @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Compute the url of the image handler.

        This method is used to create the url used to access the image handler from the client. This is the address from which the client retrieves images item and to which images are uploaded.

        Parameters:
        request - Request needed to retrieve context.
        Returns:
        Url to the image handler.

      • getUrlServlet

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String getUrlServlet(@NotNull
                                                                @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                java.lang.String servletName)
        Compute the url of a servlet.

        This method is used to create the url needed to access a servlet from the client. The name of this servlet is supplied in parameter.

        Parameters:
        request - Request needed to retrieve context.
        servletName - Servlet name.
        Returns:
        Url to the servlet.

      • parseDateParameter

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable java.util.Date parseDateParameter(@NotNull
                                                                     @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                     @NotNull
                                                                     @NotNull java.lang.String name)
        Get a date parameter.

        This method take a parameter from an HttpServletRequest request. This parameter is expected to be a date inside a String. If the content of that string doesn't conform to a date, no exception is generated but a null value is returned.

        Parameters:
        request - Request to deal with.
        name - Parameter name.
        Returns:
        Value of the parameter or null.

      • parseIntegerParameter

        public static int parseIntegerParameter(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                        @NotNull
                                        @NotNull java.lang.String name)
        Get an integer parameter.

        This method take a parameter from an HttpServletRequest request. This parameter is expected to be an integer inside a String. If the content of that string doesn't conform to an integer, no exception is generated but a zero value is returned.

        Parameters:
        request - Request to deal with.
        name - Parameter name.
        Returns:
        Value of the parameter or zero.

        This method take a parameter from an HttpServletRequest request. This parameter is expected to be a long inside a String. If the content of that string doesn't conform to a long, no exception is generated but a zero value is returned.

        Parameters:

        name - Parameter name.
        Returns:

      • saveForm

        public static void saveForm(@NotNull
                            @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Save an HTML form content.

        This method copy the received form parameters form the supplied request to their corresponding attribute to allow the form to be populated with user entered data in case of problem. This will prevent the user to enter the same information when they are good.

        Parameters:
        request - Request to deal with.
        parameters - Parameters list.

      • putFormError

        public static void putFormError(@NotNull
                                @NotNull ControllerException controllerException,
                                @NotNull
                                @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Put an error in an HTML form.

        This method read the error codes from the supplied exception and put their corresponding translated texts into HTML elements according to the parameters list. This list contains for each error code the HTML element name in which place the translated error message.

        Parameters:
        controllerException - Exception in which the error codes are.
        request - Request to deal with.
        parameters - List of HTML associated element error.

      • putFormError

                                @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Object,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Put an error in an HTML form.

        This method read the error codes from the supplied exception and put their corresponding translated texts into HTML elements according to the parameters list. This list contains for each error code the HTML element name in which place the translated error message.

        Parameters:
        modelException - Exception in which the error codes are.
        request - Request to deal with.
        parameters - List of HTML associated element error.

      • getUserFromSession

        public static User getUserFromSession(ManagerFactory managerFactory,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Read the user stored in the session.

        This method read the user that is stored in a session attribute. Because the hibernate session was closed after the user was saved in a previous http request, it is necessary to read it again from the database, because it is not in the persistence context anymore. No exception is generated and null is returned if none is found or in case of problem.

        Parameters:
        managerFactory - Instance of the manager factpry to use.
        request - Request to deal with.
        Returns:
        User found and present in the persistence context or null if none.

      • getItemFromSession

        public static Item getItemFromSession(ManagerFactory managerFactory,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Read the item stored in the session.

        This method read the item that is stored in a session attribute. Because the hibernate session was closed after the item was saved in a previous http request, it is necessary to read it again from the database, because it is not in the persistence context anymore. No exception is generated and null is returned if none is found or in case of problem.

        Parameters:
        managerFactory - Instance of the manager factpry to use.
        request - Request to deal with.
        Returns:
        Item found and present in the persistence context or null if none.
